BayesianNetworks 0.0.3
  • Reference

Fit model

Source: R/fit_model.R
fit_model.Rd

Fit model

fit_model(data = NULL, model = "default", beta = 0.01, ...)

Arguments

data

A named list containing the required data, as obtained from prepare_data().

model

character. Path to file describing the Stan model. Use in case you want to use a modified Stan model. Otherwise using "default" model provided with the package.

beta

Rate of exponential prior on r (preference) parameter. Default beta is 0.01. Increase it if you have large count numbers. (Could use plot_prior() to examine the resultant prior.

...

Further arguments for cmdstanr::sample(), like iter_warmup, iter_sampling, or thin, among others. It is recommended to increase the number of iterations (e.g. iter_sampling = 10000).

Value

A fitted model (cmdstanr::CmdStanMCMC() object).

Examples

data(web)
dt <- prepare_data(mat = web, sampl.eff = rep(20, nrow(web)))
fit <- fit_model(dt)
